item.title: Genetic testing of sperm donors
item.description: A recent New York Times article discusses the potential need for genetic screening of sperm donors. A couple of points struck me as rather odd. One, the mention of fragile X syndrome, has been corrected: An earlier version of this article erroneously included fragile X syndrome in a list of genetic diseases that have affected children conceived with donated sperm. (Although a sperm donor who is a carrier of the fragile X premutation may pass it along to his daughters, the disease, which affects twice as many boys as girls, is almost always inherited from the mother.
